alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 08 at 3:10AM MDT until May 10 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MONDAY FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS EXCEPT THE EASTERN PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Windy conditions will return across the Northeast Highlands today with gusts potentially reaching 35 mph. In addition, another dry day is expected with humidity plummeting in the afternoon, leading to critical conditions in the Northeast Highlands. Another round of critical fire weather conditions are possible on Tuesday across the Northeast Highlands before becoming more widespread and more extreme on Wednesday due to an approaching Pacific low and associated front. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau (101), North Central Mountains (120), Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley (121), Sangre De Cristo Mountains (122), West Central Mountains (105), Middle Rio Grande Valley (106), Sandia and Manzano Mountains (124), Central Highlands (125) and the West Central Basin and Range (109) from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 50 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
